artefact.overview: You need a manufacturer's authorisation from the Veterinary Medicines Directorate (VMD) to manufacture veterinary medicines in the UK
artefact.licence_short_description: Authorisation from the Veterinary Medicines Directorate (VMD) to manufacture veterinary medicines in the UK.
artefact.licence_overview:
To manufacture veterinary medicines you require a manufacturer's authorisation from the [Veterinary Medicines Directorate (VMD).](http://www.vmd.defra.gov.uk/ "Veterinary Medicines Directorate (VMD)"){:rel="external"}

A marketing authorisation will also be required.

To be authorised you must have suitable staff, premises, facilities and equipment to make, store and control the medicines and must be able to comply with the [Veterinary Medicines Regulations 2009.](http://www.legislation.gov.uk/uksi/2009/2297/contents/made "Veterinary Medicines Regulations 2009"){:rel="external"}

The authorisation will show:

- the types of products to be made or imported
- where they are to be made, your name and address and the address of the premises
- the names of qualified people who can act under the authorisation

Your premises will be inspected regularly whilst you hold an authorisation.

Medicines must be made in accordance with the marketing authorisation that relates to the product.

In addition to the general authorisation there are specific authorisations for:

- manufacturers of autogenous vaccines
- manufacturers of products for administration under the 'cascade'
- non-food animal blood banks
- equine stem cell centres

Fees are payable.
